Authors: Purnomo A., Agustina I.A., Septianto A., Liahmad, Prasetyo Y.E.
Title: Instagram literature: Insights from scientometric application
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Interior Design Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Universitas Nahdlatul Ulama Sidoarjo, Chemical Engineering Department, Sidoarjo, Indonesia; Universitas Bahaudin Mudhary Madura, Accounting Department, Sumenep, Indonesia; University of Missouri-Columbia, Department of Rural SociologyMO, United States
Authors with affiliations: Purnomo, A., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Agustina, I.A., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Interior Design Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Septianto, A., Universitas Nahdlatul Ulama Sidoarjo, Chemical Engineering Department, Sidoarjo, Indonesia; Liahmad, Universitas Bahaudin Mudhary Madura, Accounting Department, Sumenep, Indonesia; Prasetyo, Y.E., University of Missouri-Columbia, Department of Rural SociologyMO, United States
Abstract: Instagram is increasingly developing as a technopreneur-based social media for sharing photos and videos. It has been research yet the notion about Instagram literature review which showed the big picture using data from all countries. This study aims to visually map the status of international scientific literature on Instagram using the Scientometric application. The scientometric methods and analyzed research data were applied using the analysis search results service from Scopus and the VOSviewer application. The research data of 2, 521 documents published from 2010 to 2019 were obtained from the Scopus database. The results of this study indicate an increasing trend in the amount of international scientific literature on Instagram every year. Most countries, affiliation, and authors in Instagram literature were the United States, Universitas Indonesia; and Luo, J. There were three patterns of collaborative researchers in the Instagram literature. This research affirms a convergence axis classification consisting of Instagram literature to characterize the body of knowledge generated from two decades of literature: Business, Information System, Technology Human Interaction, Social Media Communication and Identity, abbreviated as BITSI themes. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Social networking (online); Body of knowledge; Human interactions; Literature reviews; Research data; Scientific literature; Scientometrics; Scopus database; Social media; Classification (of information)

Funding Text 1: Fig. 4. shows the top sponsoring Funding institution that helps in the publication of Instagram literature was the National Science Foundation with 46 documents. Then followed by the National Institutes of Health with 31 documents, the National Natural Science Foundation of China with 30 documents, the National Research Foundation of Korea with 18 documents, the Australian Research Council with 14 documents, the National Cancer Institute with 14 documents, University of Indonesia with 12 documents, Ministry of Science, ICT and Future Planning with 10 documents, National Institute on Drug Abuse with 10 documents and European Regional Development Fund with 9 documents.
